blocks.name: diff.cword.s
diff.cword.c
diff.cword.w
df-word
blocks.content: Define the class of _words over a set_. A word (sometimes also called a _string_) is a finite sequence of symbols from a set (alphabet) ` S ` . Definition in Section 9.1 of [AhoHopUll] p. 318. The domain is forced to be an initial segment of ` NN0 ` so that two words with the same symbols in the same order be equal. The set ` Word S ` is sometimes denoted by S*, using the Kleene star, although the Kleene star, or Kleene closure, is sometimes reserved to denote an operation on languages. The set ` Word S ` is the free monoid over ` S ` , where the monoid law is concatenation and the monoid unit is the empty word (see ~ frmdval ). (Contributed by FL, 14-Jan-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 14-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2016.)

blocks.name: iswrd
blocks.content: Property of being a word over a set with a quantifier over the length. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2016.) (Proof shortened by AV, 13-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm iswrd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wrex(s0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  bitri(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wrex(s0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1)), wcel(c0, cab(hs0, wrex(s0, cn0, wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1)))))
  eleq2i(c0, cword(c1), cab(hs0, wrex(s0, cn0, wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1))))
  df-word(hs0, s0, c1)
  elab3(hs0, c0, wrex(s0, cn0, wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1)), wrex(s0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1)))
  rexlimivw(s0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1), wcel(c0, universe))
  mpan2(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), universe))
  ovex(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0))
  fex(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1, universe)
  rexbidv(s0, cn0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1))
  feq1(cv(hs0), c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

  ovex(nat0, cfzo, s0)

  rexbidv(s0, cn0, hs0 = c0, (hs0 :(0[..^]s0)‚Üí c1), (c0 :(0[..^]s0)‚Üí c1))
  feq1(hs0, c0, (0[..^]s0), c1)

blocks.name: wrdval
blocks.content: Value of the set of words over a set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 10-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm wrdval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cword(c0), ciun(s0, cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0))))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  syl6reqr(cword(c0), ciun(s0, cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)))), cab(hs0, wrex(s0, cn0, wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c0))), wcel(c0, c1))
  abbi2dv(hs0, ciun(s0, cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)))), wcel(c0, c1), wrex(s0, cn0, wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c0)))
  syl5bb(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), ciun(s0, cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0))))), wrex(s0, cn0, wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c0)), wrex(s0, cn0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0))))))
  eliun(s0, cv(hs0), cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0))))
  rexbidv(s0, cn0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)))), wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c0))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)))), wf(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), c0)), wcel(co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), universe))
  ovex(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0))
  elmapg(c0, c1, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), universe, cv(hs0))
  df-word(hs0, s0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ciun(s0, cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)))))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, c1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: iswrdi
blocks.content: A zero-based sequence is a word. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm iswrdi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2), wcel(c0, cword(c2)))
} = {
  sylibr(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2), wcel(c0, cword(c2)), wrex(hs0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c2)))
  pm2.61ian(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2), wrex(hs0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c2)), wcel(c1, cn0))
  rspcev(hs0, c1, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c2))
  feq2d(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c2, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), c1, nat0, cfzo)
  sylancr(wa(wn(wcel(c1, cn0)), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2)), wrex(hs0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c2)), wcel(nat0, cn0), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, nat0), c2))
  0nn0()
  biimpa(wn(wcel(c1, cn0)), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, nat0), c2))
  feq2d(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2, co(nat0, cfzo, nat0), wn(wcel(c1, cn0)))
  syl6eqr(co(nat0, cfzo, c1), co(nat0, cfzo, nat0), emptycls, wn(wcel(c1, cn0)))
  necon1bi(co(nat0, cfzo, c1), emptycls, wcel(c1, cn0))
  sylbi(wne(co(nat0, cfzo, c1), emptycls), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c1, cn))
  fzo0n0(c1)
  nnnn0(c1)
  fzo0(nat0)
  rspcev(hs0, nat0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, nat0), c2), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c2))
  feq2d(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c2, co(nat0, cfzo, nat0), wceq(cv(hs0), nat0))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), nat0, nat0, cfzo)
  iswrd(hs0, c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cn0)
  diff.hs0.w(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1), c2))
  diff.hs0.c(nat0)
  diff.hs0.w(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, nat0), c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

thm iswrdi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  feq2d(c0, (0[..^]hs0), c2, (0[..^]c1), hs0 = c1)

  sylancr((¬¨ c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß(c0 :(0[..^]c1)‚Üí c2)), ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0,(c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c2)), 0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, (c0 :(0[..^]0)‚Üí c2))
  0nn0()
  biimpa(¬¨ c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, (c0 :(0[..^]c1)‚Üí c2), (c0 :(0[..^]0)‚Üí c2))
  feq2d(c0, (0[..^]c1), c2, (0[..^]0), ¬¨ c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  syl6eqr((0[..^]c1), (0[..^]0), emptycls, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  necon1bi((0[..^]c1), emptycls, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  sylbi((0[..^]c1)‚â† ‚àÖ, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  fzo0n0(c1)
  nnnn0(c1)

  rspcev(hs0, nat0, cn0, (c0 :(0[..^]0)‚Üí c2), (c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c2))
  feq2d(c0, (0[..^]hs0), c2, (0[..^]0), hs0 = 0)

blocks.name: wrdf
blocks.content: A word is a zero-based sequence with a recoverable upper limit. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm wrdf(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), c1))
} = {
  sylbi(wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), c1), wrex(hs0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c1)))
  iswrd(hs0, c0, c1)
  rexlimiva(hs0, cn0, wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c1), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), c1))
  mpbird(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cn0), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c1)), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), c1), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c1))
  simpr(wcel(cv(hs0), cn0), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c1))
  feq2d(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), c1, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cn0), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c1)))
  oveq2d(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0), cv(hs0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cn0), wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), c1)))
  fnfzo0hash(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wf(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), c1))
}

thm wrdf(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Word(c1)‚Üí(c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Üí c1))
} = {
  sylbi(c0 ‚àà Word(c1), (c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Üí c1), ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0,(c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c1)))
  iswrd(hs0, c0, c1)
  rexlimiva(hs0, cn0, (c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c1), (c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Üí c1))
  mpbird((hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß(c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c1)), (c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Üí c1), (c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c1))
  simpr(hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, (c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c1))
  feq2d(c0, (0[..^](# ` c0)), c1, (0[..^]hs0), (hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß(c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c1)))
  oveq2d(nat0, cfzo, (# ` c0), hs0, (hs0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß(c0 :(0[..^]hs0)‚Üí c1)))
  fnfzo0hash(hs0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 :(0[..^](# ` c0))‚Üí c1))

blocks.name: iswrdb
blocks.content: A word over an alphabet is a function from an open range of nonnegative integers (of length equal to the length of the word) into the alphabet. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Jul-2018.)

blocks.name: wrddm
blocks.content: The indices of a word (i.e. its domain regarded as function) are elements of an open range of nonnegative integers (of length equal to the length of the word). (Contributed by AV, 2-May-2020.)

blocks.name: sswrd
blocks.content: The set of words respects ordering on the base set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2016.) (Proof shortened by AV, 13-May-2020.)

blocks.name: snopiswrd
blocks.content: A singleton of an ordered pair (with 0 as first component) is a word. (Contributed by AV, 23-Nov-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: wrdexg
blocks.content: The set of words over a set is a set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2016.) (Proof shortened by JJ, 18-Nov-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm wrdexg(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cword(c0), universe))
} = {
  eqeltrd(cword(c0), universe, ciun(hs0, cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)))), wcel(c0, c1))
  wrdval(hs0, c0, c1)
  sylancr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ciun(hs0, cn0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)))), universe), wcel(cn0, universe), wral(hs0, cn0, wcel(co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0))), universe)))
  nn0ex()
  ralrimiva(hs0, cn0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0))), universe))
  ovexd(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cn0)))
  iunexg(hs0, cn0, universe, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(hs0))), universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cn0)
}

blocks.name: wrdexi
blocks.content: The set of words over a set is a set, inference form. (Contributed by AV, 23-May-2021.)

blocks.name: wrdsymbcl
blocks.content: A symbol within a word over an alphabet belongs to the alphabet. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 28-Jun-2018.)

blocks.name: wrdfn
blocks.content: A word is a function with a zero-based sequence of integers as domain. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 13-Apr-2018.)

blocks.name: wrdv
blocks.content: A word over an alphabet is a word over the universal class. (Contributed by AV, 8-Feb-2021.) (Proof shortened by JJ, 18-Nov-2022.)

blocks.name: wrdvOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete proof of ~ wrdv as of 23-Apr-2023. (Contributed by AV, 8-Feb-2021.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: wrdlndm
blocks.content: The length of a word is not in the domain of the word (regarded as a function). (Contributed by AV, 3-Mar-2021.) (Proof shortened by JJ, 18-Nov-2022.)

blocks.name: wrdlndmOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete proof of ~ wrdlndm as of 1-May-2023. (Contributed by AV, 3-Mar-2021.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: iswrdsymb
blocks.content: An arbitrary word is a word over an alphabet if all of its symbols belong to the alphabet. (Contributed by AV, 23-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: wrdfin
blocks.content: A word is a finite set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Nov-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Nov-2018.)

blocks.name: lencl
blocks.content: The length of a word is a nonnegative integer. This corresponds to the definition in Section 9.1 of [AhoHopUll] p. 318. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 27-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: lennncl
blocks.content: The length of a nonempty word is a positive integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: wrdffz
blocks.content: A word is a function from a finite interval of integers. (Contributed by AV, 10-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: wrdeq
blocks.content: Equality theorem for the set of words. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Feb-2016.)

blocks.name: wrdeqi
blocks.content: Equality theorem for the set of words, inference form. (Contributed by AV, 23-May-2021.)

blocks.name: iswrddm0
blocks.content: A function with empty domain is a word. (Contributed by AV, 13-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: wrd0
blocks.content: The empty set is a word (the _empty word_, frequently denoted ε in this context). This corresponds to the definition in Section 9.1 of [AhoHopUll] p. 318. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 13-May-2020.)

blocks.name: 0wrd0
blocks.content: The empty word is the only word over an empty alphabet. (Contributed by AV, 25-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: ffz0iswrd

blocks.name: wrdnval
blocks.content: Words of a fixed length are mappings from a fixed half-open integer interval. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Mar-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 13-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm wrdnval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wceq(crab(s0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  syl6reqr(crab(s0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2)), cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  abbi2dv(s0, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0))
  syldan(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0), wb(wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2))), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0)), wcel(co(nat0, cfzo, c2), universe))
  ovexd(nat0, cfzo, c2, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  elmapg(c0, c1, co(nat0, cfzo, c2), universe, cv(s0))
  impbid1(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)))
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)))
  jca(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0)), wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)))
  iswrdi(cv(s0), c2, c0)
  adantll(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2))
  fnfzo0hash(c2, cv(s0), c0)
  imp(wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0))
  syl5ibcom(wcel(cv(s0), cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, c2), c0), wf(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), c0))
  wrdf(cv(s0), c0)
  feq2d(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s0))), c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c2), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2))
  oveq2(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2, nat0, cfzo)
  df-rab(s0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2))
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2))
  diff.cmap.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat0, cfzo, c2)
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cfzo.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c2, cn0)
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
}

  syldan(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, (s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶](0[..^]c2))‚Üî(s0 :(0[..^]c2)‚Üí c0)), (0[..^]c2)‚àà ùïå)
  ovexd(nat0, cfzo, c2, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0))

  jca(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(s0 :(0[..^]c2)‚Üí c0)), s0 ‚àà Word(c0), (# ` s0)= c2)
  adantl((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0), (s0 :(0[..^]c2)‚Üí c0), s0 ‚àà Word(c0))
  iswrdi(s0, c2, c0)
  adantll(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, (s0 :(0[..^]c2)‚Üí c0), (# ` s0)= c2)
  fnfzo0hash(c2, s0, c0)
  imp(s0 ‚àà Word(c0), (# ` s0)= c2, (s0 :(0[..^]c2)‚Üí c0))
  syl5ibcom(s0 ‚àà Word(c0), (# ` s0)= c2, (s0 :(0[..^]c2)‚Üí c0), (s0 :(0[..^](# ` s0))‚Üí c0))
  wrdf(s0, c0)
  feq2d(s0, (0[..^](# ` s0)), c0, (0[..^]c2), (# ` s0)= c2)
  oveq2((# ` s0), c2, nat0, cfzo)
  df-rab(s0, Word(c0), (# ` s0)= c2)
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cmap, (0[..^]c2))

  diff.cfzo.s(s0)

}

blocks.name: wrdmap
blocks.content: Words as a mapping. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 4-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm wrdmap(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wb(wa(wcel(c3, cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, c3), c2)), wcel(c3, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2)))))
} = {
  syl5bbr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)), wa(wcel(c3, cword(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, c3), c2)), wcel(c3, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2))), wcel(c3, crab(hs0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2))))
  elrab(hs0, c3, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2), wceq(cfv(chash, c3), c2))
  fveqeq2(cv(hs0), c3, chash, c2)
  eleq2d(c3, crab(hs0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), c2)), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  wrdnval(hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(cword(c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(chash, c3), c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: hashwrdn
blocks.content: If there is only a finite number of symbols, the number of words of a fixed length over these sysmbols is the number of these symbols raised to the power of the length. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Mar-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashwrdn(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cn0)), wceq(cfv(chash, crab(s0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1))), co(cfv(chash, c0), cexp, c1)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(chash, crab(s0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1))), co(cfv(chash, c0), cexp, c1), cfv(chash, co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  fveq2d(chash, crab(s0, cword(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1)), co(c0, cmap, co(nat0, cfzo, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cn0)))
  wrdnval(s0, c0, cfn, c1)

blocks.content: Two words are equal iff they have the same length and the same symbol at each position. (Contributed by AV, 13-Apr-2018.)

  fveq2(co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), chash)
  eqeqan12d(cfv(chash, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0))), cfv(chash, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2))), cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, c2), wcel(c0, cword(c1)), wcel(c2, cword(c1)))

thm elovmpt2wrd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {

  rabeqdv(s2, cword(cv(s0)), csb(hs0, cv(s0), cword(cv(hs0))), wa(wcel(cv(s0), universe), wcel(cv(s1), universe)), w0)
  adantr(wcel(cv(s0), universe), wcel(cv(s1), universe), wceq(cword(cv(s0)), csb(hs0, cv(s0), cword(cv(hs0)))))

  sylbid(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe)), wcel(c0, csb(hs0, c1, cword(cv(hs0)))), w3a(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c0, cword(c1))), wcel(c0, cword(c1)))
  adantr(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c3, universe), wb(wcel(c0, csb(hs0, c1, cword(cv(hs0)))), wcel(c0, cword(c1))))

  eqcomd(Word(s0), [s0 / hs0]Word(hs0), s0 ‚àà ùïå)

  adantr(c1 ‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚àà ùïå, (c0 ‚àà[c1 / hs0]Word(hs0)‚Üî c0 ‚àà Word(c1)))

thm elovmptnn0wrd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {

  elovmpt3imp(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, cn0, crab(s3, cword(cv(s0)), w0))
